channel.title: HPC on New River, New Water
channel.description: Recent content in HPC on New River, New Water
channel.item:
Remarks on concepts in Flynn's taxonomy http://localhost:1313/remarks-on-concepts-in-flynns-taxonomy/ Mon, 04 Nov 2024 00:43:02 +0900 <<<<<<< HEAD http://localhost:1313/remarks-on-concepts-in-flynns-taxonomy/

The so-called Flynn’s taxonomy is proposed by Michael J. Flynn in his paper Very high-speed computing systems and Some Computer Organizations and Their Effectiveness published in 1970s.[1]

It categorizes computer architectures based on single/multiple instruction and single/multiple data into 4 types: SISD(Single Instruction Single Data), MISD(Multiple Instruction Single Data), SIMD(Single Instruction Multiple Data), MIMD(Multiple Instruction Multiple Data). The 4 acronyms are easy to get by simple combinations, but the key here is to understand their concepts and applications.

======= https://mooxiu.github.io/remarks-on-concepts-in-flynns-taxonomy/ The so-called Flynn’s taxonomy is proposed by Michael J. The 4 acronyms are easy to get by simple combinations, but the key here is to understand their concepts and applications. >>>>>>> d42af2c63a5acb204af7120668b30855c1d0b24f
